profileText: (Grandnephew of Rudolph Kleberg, nephew of Harry McLeary Wurzbach, cousin of Richard Mifflin Kleberg, Sr.), a Representative from Texas; born in Austin, Travis County, Tex., July 16, 1913; B.A., University of Texas, 1935; LL.B., University of Texas, 1939; United States Army, 1942-1944; Southwestern Director of Office of Coordinator of Inter-American Affairs, 1944-1945; member of the Texas state house of representatives, 1958-1966; elected as a Democrat to the Ninetieth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1967-January 3, 1981); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Ninety-seventh Congress in 1980; died on November 13, 2001, in Austin, Tex.; interment in Austin Memorial Cemetery, Austin, Tex.

researchRecord.name: 1997, 4 tapes.
researchRecord.description: The oral history interviews include two conducted of Bob Eckhardt by David Todd and Gary Keith on February 19, 1997 and June 30, 1997. The transcripts are available online. The interviews cover discussions of conservation in Texas.

researchRecord.name: 1931-1992, 364 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The Robert C. Eckhardt Papers include photographs, correspondence, articles, notes, campaign material, audio material and ephemera ranging from 1931-1992, which reflects the liberal political career of Robert Christian "Bob" Eckhardt, co-founder of the Texas Observer magazine, labor lawyer for the AFL-CIO, representative to the Texas House of Representatives, and Representative to the United States House of Representatives. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.
